Package com.clorabase.clorastore

Class Clorastore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clorabase.clorastore.Clorastore
  • public class Clorastore
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the top-level class of the whole database. Every database operation or any configuration change in it is performed using this class. You can configure your database behaviour from here. The database is located in the path returned by Context.getDataDir().
    Since:
    2021
    Author:
    Rahil khan
    See Also:
    Github for more info.

      • getInstance

        public static Clorastore getInstance​(android.content.Context context,
                                     java.lang.String name)

        Parameters:
        context - The context of the application or activity.
        Returns:
        instance of the class.
        Throws:
        ClorastoreException - - if database was not created successfully.

      • getDatabase

        public Collection getDatabase()
        Returns the root of the database. This root may or may not contain collection.
        Returns:
        Collection

      • getDatabase

        public Collection getDatabase​(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Returns the collection defined by the relative path from the root of the database. For example, passing "/students/junior" will return collection "junior" which is present in collection "student".
        Parameters:
        relativePath - Relative path of the connection from the root.
        Returns:
        Collection
        Throws:
        ClorastoreException - If relativePath does not denotes an existing collection

      • delete

        public boolean delete()
        Deletes the current database of which instance is.
        Returns:
        true if succeed, false otherwise (IOException occured)

      • clean

        public boolean clean()
        Cleans the database root without deleting it. The database will be still there after cleaning it. This will just delete all the collection in its root.
        Returns:
        true if succeed, false otherwise (IOException occured)
